docs.snippet: A winning design team with New York in its DNA....
docs.lead_paragraph: A winning design team with New York in its DNA.
docs.abstract: Public School designers Maxwell Osborne and Dao-Yi Chow have New York, and its sports teams, in their DNA, and are on the rise in fashion world; duo is something of an aberration among men's wear designers who traffic in clothes with athletic references because they actually care, deeply, about sports, especially basketball.

headline.seo: Behind Public School, Fashion Designers From New York City
headline.main: The Point Men for Public School

docs.lead_paragraph: The L.P.G.A. Tour on Wednesday announced a season-long points race, offering $1 million to the winner.
docs.abstract: LPGA and title sponsor CME Group unveil season-long points race called Race to the CME Globe, which will have a $1 million bonus, largest in women's golf; feature will be added to tour's season in 2014.

headline.main: L.P.G.A. Adds Points Race and a $1 Million Bonus

docs.snippet: Rescue workers were astonished that Azzura’e Wilson was alive after a brutal car accident that left her paralyzed, and now she is determined to walk again....
docs.lead_paragraph: Rescue workers were astonished that Azzura’e Wilson was alive after a brutal car accident that left her paralyzed, and now she is determined to walk again.
docs.abstract: Children’s Aid Society, supported by The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund, awards Azzura'e Wilson of the South Bronx $310 for clothes and school supplies; she survived a car accident in her junior year in high school that left her paralyzed, but she is determined to graduate and to walk again.

headline.main: After a Brush With Death, Focusing on the Next Step
headline.print_headline: After a Brush With Death, Focusing on the Next Step

docs.snippet: An encounter with Jaime Weston-Parouse, vice president for brand and creative at the N.F.L....
docs.lead_paragraph: An encounter with Jaime Weston-Parouse, vice president for brand and creative at the N.F.L.
docs.abstract: Profile of Jaime Weston-Parouse, vice president for brand and creative at the National Football League; she describes working with the league, licensees, sponsors, broadcast partners and teams to present a cohesive brand image and message, a function that did not exist when she was hired in 2003.

headline.seo: At the N.F.L., Jaime Weston-Parouse Is Vice President for Brand and Creative
headline.print_headline: In the Running, Behind the Scenes
